Addendum - II to AvSec Order No. 11/2015 dated 14.12.2015

Subject: Security Measures for Regulated Agents.

In exercise of powers conferred under rules 46 and 62 of the Aircraft
(Security) Rules, 2023, Director General, Bureau of Civil Aviation Security, for
the purpose of the safety of passengers, crew, ground personnel and the
general public in all matters relating to safeguarding against act of unlawful
interference with civil aviation, directs for partial modification to AvSec Order
11/2015 dated 14.12.2015 issued on the subject matter:

2. Para 16.9 is inserted below 16.8 which reads as under:

16.9 “The security measures described in AvSec Circular 6/2024 shall be

applicable to Regulated Agent’.

3. Contents of the existing Para 8.8 is hereby deleted and new contents is
hereby inserted in-situ which reads as under:

8.8. ‘If the security measures are assessed to be not as per the
prescribed standards, the DG BCAS shall inform the applicant about the
shortcomings. The onus for application of re-inspection after rectification of
observation shall lie with the applicant. On receipt of fresh application
from the applicant, the inspection procedure mentioned above shall be
followed and in case of the applicant's inability to meet the requirements
for Regulated Agent, the DG BCAS may disqualify the applicant.”

9. Contents of the existing Para 13(c) is hereby deleted and new contents
is hereby inserted in-situ which reads as under:

13 (c) Entity shall establish/ confirm the nature of consignments in terms of size,
stability, weight and density during screening of the cargo to ensure that IBDs
‘are not concealed in consignments, Entity shall also ensure that all cargo are X-
ray screened unless the same is not possible due to its nature. Such cargo shall
be subjected to physical search, ETD and/or Explosive Detection Dogs. The
{following screening methodology shall be applied on cargo or mail based on the
nature of the consignment:

i) General Cargo including VAL screening: X-Ray/Physical Search
and/or Explosives Detection System or Explosives Detection Dogs.

ii) Perishable Cargo or fresh produce: X-Ray/Physical Search and/or
Explosives Detection System or Explosives Detection Dogs.

iii) Dense cargo shall undergo physical search, ETD and/or Explosive
Detection Dogs in addition to X-ray screening.

iv) Live Animal: Visual and/or Physical check along with ETD shall be
‘performed on live animals. All accompanying items, such as feedbags,
cages and containers, shall be subjected to security controls such as X-
Ray/ Physical search and ETD.

v) Dangerous Goods: Carriage of Dangerous Goods including radioactive
materials, shall be in accordance with The Aircraft (Carriage of
Dangerous Goods) Rules, 2003. Such consignments shall be subjected
to X-ray screening and/or ETD.

vi) Oversized Consignments: shall undergo Physical Search followed by
ETD and/or Explosive Detection Dogs.

vii) Biomedical samples, vaccines, perishable medical items: shall be
subjected to a thorough verification of shipping documents to ensure
that the cargo matches the description on shipping documents. Visual
check shalll be carried out for any sign of tampering and establishment
of genuineness of consigner.

vii) Life-sustaining items such as blood, blood products, bone
marrow: All relevant documents shall be verified. Visual check shall be
carried out for any sign of tampering,

i) Unaccompanied baggage carried as air cargo: All such cargo shall
undergo X-ray screening, physical search and/or ETD or Explosive
Detection Dogs.

x) Human remains: All relevant documents shall be verified, and HUM
shall be screened through X-ray machine to ensure that it doesn’t
contain any prohibited / dangerous item.
